intro: Drosanthemum austricola, commonly known as the Australian daisy, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, which is characterized by its succulent leaves and showy flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, with a distinctive star-shaped appearance. Drosanthemum austricola is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and blooms.
